definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Paleontologists know chert as a good place to look for fossils.
sentences.chinese: 古生物學者知道黑矽石同樣的好地方去觀看化石。

sentences.english: The work appears in the journal Paleobiology.
sentences.chinese: 研究報告發表在《古生物學》雜誌上。

sentences.english: None of my questions have anything to do with paleontology.
sentences.chinese: 我的問題沒有一條是關於古生物學的。

sentences.english: Information about paleoclimates is increasingly available, and being used in paleontology.
sentences.chinese: 關於古氣候的信息越來越多，並且被用於古生物學。

sentences.english: This site is a complex information resource on paleontological and zoological classification.
sentences.chinese: 此站點提供有關古生物學和動物學分類的信息資源。

sentences.english: She is a specialist in paleontology.
sentences.chinese: 她是古生物學方面的專家。

sentences.english: Electing new officials of the International Palaeontological Association.
sentences.chinese: 選舉新一屆國際古生物學會領導成員。

sentences.english: He has been studying palaeontology with great tenacity.
sentences.chinese: 他一直鍥而不捨地研究古生物學。
